title: Watch: Note of harmony: On the debate on Vande Mataram: The Hindu Editorial
content: This year marks the 150th anniversary of the song Vande Mataram. It is only fitting that the country remembers the story of the song, its spirit, and its purpose in nation-building. Unfortunately, the parliamentary discussion to commemorate the anniversary of the song turned into a partisan diatribe in which old wounds were reopened and dormant grievances reframed.

title: Opposition walks out in Rajya Sabha over BJP MP’s withdrawal of forensic question
content: Congress leads protest after question on forensic capabilities under new criminal laws is withdrawn without explanation

title: HPZ token scam case: CBI files charge sheet against two Chinese nationals

title: Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil gets anticipatory bail in second rape case

content: A police team visited Shantipur and took the sack containing voter cards for verification and said that the investigation is underway

title: DGCA asks IndiGo CEO to appear on December 11 with full data on flight disruptions, updates

title: Four injured in blast during Hornbill festival in Nagaland
content: “The incident occurred on the premises of a morung, belonging to the Sangtam tribe, on December 9, when the gunpowder caught fire and burst,” an official said

title: Row erupts over allegations that Suresh Gopi voted in Thrissur and Thiruvananthapuram
content: CPI, Congress question how the Union Minister voted in Thrissur for Lok Sabha polls and in Thiruvananthapuram for Kerala local body polls

title: Licences of 176 retailers, 39 wholesalers cancelled over substandard medicines: Maharashtra Minister
content: Maharashtra’s Food and Drug Administration Minister said 36 samples were tested at 10 locations across Mumbai, Thane, Pune, Aurangabad and Nagpur divisions, of which 34 were found to be substandard

title: CM Stalin determines target of 440 votes for DMK at his booth
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister and DMK president M.K. Stalin, spearheading the ‘My Booth–Victory Booth’ movement, stated that the army of black and red shirts will confront the Shahs of Delhi

title: 44 retired judges slam ‘motivated campaign’ against CJI over remarks on Rohingyas
content: “The Chief Justice is being attacked for asking the most basic legal question: who, in law, has granted the status that is being claimed before the Court?”

content: Chief Minister Revanth Reddy, speaking at the launch of Google for Startups Hub at Hyderabad’s famous incubator T-Hub, said his government is committed to work together to create a winning ecosystem

content: Kerala High Court Advocates’ Association cites ‘potential breach of confidentiality’ regarding order by Ernakulam District and Principal Sessions Court

content: He used to accuse his wife of too much involvement in phone use and neglecting household chores as well as not caring for their children properly

title: KPCC president Sunny Joseph says UDF convenor’s remarks on actor rape case verdict on Kerala polling day ‘avoidable’
content: Sunny Joseph says Adoor Prakash’s statement created ‘confusion’, prompting him to clarify the party’s position that Congress firmly stands with the survivor

title: Impeachment motion against judge amounts to ‘weaponisation’ of Constitution: Pawan Kalyan
content: He stated in a social media post that when a constitutional Bench of the Supreme Court delivered the Sabarimala judgment no judge was impeached

title: Kerala court defers Congress leader Sandeep Varier’s anticipatory bail plea in survivor-defamation case to December 15
content: Prosecution tells court that it requires more time to process and forensically examine ‘incriminating’ social media posts attributed by the complainant to Sandeep Varier. However, it is unclear whether the judge stayed Varier’s arrest till the next hearing

title: Karnataka readies legislation to provide menstrual leave, expands scope to include students and transpersons
content: The first such legislation in the country, the Bill not only expands the scope those eligible for leave, but also proposes setting up Karnataka Women Well Being Authority

title: India's new flight duty norms appear more restrictive compared to other jurisdictions: IATA DG
content: The second phase of the Flight Duty Time Limitations (FDTL) norms have restricted the number of night landings a pilot can make, among other aspects

title: Goa CM holds high-level meet ahead of Christmas, New Year celebrations
content: The meeting was held against the backdrop of the December 6 fire tragedy at Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub at Arpora in North Goa in which 25 persons were killed, according to sources

title: Arecanut imported from LDECs in 2024-25 accounted for 1.5% of India’s domestic production, says Union Minister
content: As per government data, the annual average price of arecanut has remained above ₹40,000 per quintal during the last four years, and has not shown any significant decline

title: Health Ministry launches awareness campaign in Delhi metro on women's health, well-being
content: The campaign will deliver messages on women's safety, mental health support, digital inclusion, Pre-Conception and Prenatal Diagnostic Techniques (PC-PNDT) and tuberculosis awareness across metro trains and select stations

title: Centre approves road projects worth ₹44,771 crore for Odisha
content: The approved projects included widening of the National Highway between Bhubaneswar and Puri, and the 140-km-long Tangi-Puintola-Ichchapuram Road

title: From Colonial Kitchens to Kerala Plantations: The story of India’s first Christmas cake
content: In 19th-century Kerala, families in Pala and Kanjirappally adapted European plum cakes with local spices and rum-soaked fruits. Today, young bakers are reviving heirloom recipes, baked in small batches in borma ovens

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT defers recording Ramesh Chennithala’s statement
content: SIT was slated to record Chennithala’s statement at Kerala Police Crime Branch office at 11 a.m. The MLA’s office said SIT contacted them at 10 a.m. and informed that investigating officer was indisposed without citing any reason

title: Hours Before Hearing, Key Sandeshkhali Witness Injured In Crash, Son Killed
content: A key witness in cases linked to the Sandeshkhali controversy in West Bengal has been seriously injured in a road accident, in which his younger son and the driver of his car were killed.

title: Uber Launches Goods Delivery Service, Metro Ticket Booking In Bengaluru
content: Uber launched its B2B logistics service, Uber Direct, in Bengaluru along with metro ticketing integration for Namma Metro, both powered by the Open Network for Digital Commerce

title: "Don't Want To Die": In Video Before Suicide, UP Man Accuses Wife Of Cheating
content: A 30-year-old man in Uttar Pradesh died by suicide after he alleged that his wife was cheating on him. The man, a resident of Bankat village, was found hanging from a fan in his room.

title: Explained: 10-Year Jail For Hate Speech In Karnataka Under Proposed Law
content: The Karnataka Hate Speech and Hate Crimes (Prevention) Bill, 2025, has been tabled in the Winter Session of the Legislative Assembly in Belagavi, proposing a comprehensive standalone law aimed at curbing hate speech across the state.

title: "How Can Airlines Charge Rs 39,000?" Court To Centre On IndiGo Crisis
content: The court told the Centre that while it "appreciates their efforts" in handling the chaos, why such a situation had precipitated in the first place.

title: Pakistan Pushes For A South Asian Bloc Without India. Why It May Never Work
content: Pakistan is trying to challenge India's long-standing dominance in South Asian geopolitics with a new proposal to alter regional alliances.

title: Kangana Ranaut's 'Apology' To Brazil Woman, Face Of Congress Vote Theft Claim
content: Actor and BJP MP Kangana Ranaut has apologised to the Brazilian woman who became the phase of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's claims of 'vote-chori' in the Haryana Assembly election.

title: 7-Year-Old Girl Brutalised With Iron Rod After Rape Attempt In Gujarat
content: A horrific case of a minor's assault has emerged from Gujarat's Rajkot in which a rod was inserted into a seven-year-old's private parts after an attempted rape by the perpetrator.

title: Trinamool Plans Daily Protests In Parliament Over Bengal Dues
content: The Trinamool Congress is set to mount a series of daily, issue-specific protests in Parliament during the Winter Session, with the party focusing squarely on what it describes as long-pending central government dues to West Bengal, sources said.

title: "We Are Also Victims": Details Of Luthra Brothers' Pre-Arrest Bail Plea In Goa Fire Case
content: The Luthra brothers have claimed to be the victims in the fire tragedy that engulfed their Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub in Goa last Sunday and left 25 people dead.

title: Polyester Shawls Sold As Silk In Rs 54 Crore Scam In Tirupati Temple
content: The scandal came to light following an internal vigilance inquiry that found that a contractor consistently supplied 100% polyester shawls while billing them as the pure mulberry silk products.

title: 'Drunk' UP Man, Nephew Operate On Woman After Watching YouTube, She Dies
content: A woman in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki died after the owner of an illegal clinic and his nephew performed a surgery on her after watching a YouTube video tutorial.

title: "Thrilled": PM Modi Hails Deepavali's Addition To UNESCO List
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi stated on Wednesday that people in India and around the world are thrilled that Deepavali has been added to UNESCO's Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity.

title: "Filthy, Dirty, Disgusting": Trump's Racist Tirade Against African Migrants
content: Unleashing a xenophobic tirade, US President Donald Trump disparaged Somalia as "filthy, dirty, disgusting, ridden with crime", calling immigrants from the African nation "garbage" he does not want in America.

title: Explained: What Microsoft's $17.5 Billion AI Investment Means For India
content: Microsoft has announced a record $17.5 billion investment in India, its largest-ever commitment in Asia, over the next four years to expand AI infrastructure, deepen cloud capacity and train millions in advanced digital skills.

title: H-1B Visa Appointments Postponed For Many Indians Amid US' Social Media Rules
content: The US Embassy in India warned that any visa applicant arriving at the consulate on a previously scheduled interview date after being notified of a reschedule will be refused entry.

title: Dog Photos, VPNs, Fake IDs: How Australian Teens Are Beating Social Media Ban
content: Australia's world-first social media ban for under-16s came into effect on Wednesday, but teens are already finding ways around it.

title: Amid Reports Over Health Concern, Trump Says, "Aced 3rd Cognitive Exam"
content: President Donald Trump said he had recently "aced" a third cognitive exam as he looked to bat down questions about his age and acuity.

title: Watch: Python Revived With CPR After Head Injury In Gujarat
content: A python was rescued in Gujarat after the combined efforts of the Forest Department and a Dediapada-based animal welfare activist from the organisation called Jivdaya Premi.

title: Deepavali inscribed on UNESCO's Intangible Cultural Heritage list
content: PM Narendra Modi welcomed the addition, saying it will contribute to the festival’s global popularity

title: Kerala local body polls: As Kochi Corporation awaits new council, experts and residents flag core urban challenges
content: People’s opinions range from outright criticism to cautious optimism, and concerns about the lack of clarity on the direction Kochi city should adopt for future development

title: Four constables killed as their vehicle collides with truck in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar
content: “The police registered a case, and a search was on for the truck driver. The bodies were sent for post-mortem,” the police said

title: Greater Mysuru push: KSRTC eyes infrastructure boost with four new depots
content: According to an official, at least six acres of land is required for building a full-fledged depot, while two acres is essential for developing a city bus terminus

title: IndiGo cancels 77 flights at Hyderabad airport on December 10, total disruptions cross 700
content: Airport authorities said the passengers affected by Wednesday’s cancellations had been informed in advance

title: Tonga ride experience in Mysuru among tourism projects approved by Union Minister

title: Parliament Winter session Day 8 LIVE: Rajya Sabha continues discussion on 150th anniversary of Vande Mataram
content: The Lok Sabha continues its discussion on election reforms; the Rajya Sabha will take up discussion on election reforms on Thursday (December 11, 2025)

title: Over 30% students of secondary level in Odisha not able to make transition to higher level: CAG
content: During 2018-23, 1.50 lakh out of 5.47 lakh children enrolled in classes I to XI, discontinued education before reaching the immediate higher class, the agency finds

title: PMO reviews IndiGo flight disruptions with officials from Ministry of Civil Aviation, DGCA and AAI

title: Bihar cabinet approves creation of three new departments

title: Everyone should register themselves as Hindus in upcoming census, asks VHP president
content: The VHP’s request came in response to demands from various sections of society, like Adivasis, to include a separate religion code for them

title: The mysterious death of Annamalai University student Udayakumar 54 years ago
content: In July 1971, a controversy was triggered by Annamalai University conferring the honorary degree of Doctor of Letters upon then Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi. The sad aspect of the row was the death of K.P. Udayakumar, a third-year student of B.Sc. (Maths), under circumstances that have remained a mystery to date.

title: Torture in Madras 140 years ago: when a man’s moustache was pulled out
content: Two mid-19th century testimonies reveal the brutal torture routinely inflicted by local officials in Madras; the accounts formed part of the Madras Torture Commission report

title: Goa nightclub fire: ‘I am only a partner,’ says detained co-owner Ajay Gupta

title: Gemini Ganesan-starrer Avvaiyar brings alive temple at Thirumullaivoyal
content: I could not help reflecting on how much of a valuable record cinema is when it comes to capturing heritage for posterity. And at the same time, it also highlights what we have lost

title: Congress seeks M.P. Minister’s resignation over brother’s arrest for marijuana smuggling

title: Committee to Protect Journalists writes to PM Modi, urges him to address the matter of jailed journalists
content: Noting that India is a signatory to the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, the non-profit press freedom organisation said it was incumbent upon the government to “uphold its international and domestic human rights obligations”.

title: Kejriwal says Gujarat govt stopped him from meeting jailed farmers
content: He charged that the current administration had behaved in a manner “far harsher than what our freedom fighters could have imagined from an independent Indian government.”

title: No deaths due to air pollution, Centre tells Rajya Sabha
content: Health effects of air pollution are a synergistic manifestation of factors which include food habits, occupational habits, socio-economic status, medical history, immunity, heredity, etc. of the individuals, says Minister of State for Health Prataprao Jadhav

title: A deep cleaning of India’s electoral rolls
content: The revision and verification of electoral rolls is a routine and necessary process. Such corrections do not, by themselves, imply disenfranchisement or targeting

title: CM Revanth to visit Osmania University on Dec.10
content: The visit carries symbolic weight, coinciding with the 16th anniversary of the announcement to carve out Telangana as a separate State, on December 9, 2009

title: T.N.’s type 1 diabetes registry enrols over 5,000 children, specialised care centres being expanded
content: Launched in August 2024, the registry serves as a critical tool in improving survival rates, ensuring continuity of care, and enhancing the quality of life for children and adolescents with T1DM in the State

title: India, Brunei hold inaugural defence JWG meet
content: Key areas of discussion include the expansion of military-to-military exchanges, joint training and enhanced maritime security cooperation

title: Leh body seeks public input on fresh draft proposal for MHA on issues faced by Ladakh
content: The LAB seeks transparency and inclusive participation, rather than just social media comments, says its member, Mustafa Haji

title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi questions EC, slams RSS, warns of threat to democracy in Lok Sabha
content: Rahul Gandhi delivered a blistering speech in the Lok Sabha during the election reforms debate, accusing the government and the Election Commission of institutional capture, raising concerns over “vote chori,” and questioning changes to key electoral laws. He also criticised the RSS, celebrated India’s democratic spirit, and proposed urgent reforms to protect free and fair elections.

title: IndiGo flight cuts to spike airfares in peak season, leave passengers with few options
content: Back-of-the-envelope calculations indicate that reducing daily flights from 400 to 500 will affect 65,000 to 81,000 daily passengers, who had probably booked their seats weeks in advance

title: Land for integrated check-posts in West Bengal in different stages of acquisition: MHA
content: The West Bengal Government accorded approval for land acquisition only on November 21, 2023, and the Central Government has made the requisite payment to the State, Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said in a written reply to the Lok Sabha

title: White Sox win draft lottery, will pick 1st in 2026
content: The White Sox, who had the best odds to win the 2026 MLB draft lottery, will pick first in next summer's draft, followed by the Rays at No. 2 and the Twins at No. 3.

title: Sources: Tigers give Finnegan 2-year, $19M pact
content: Kyle Finnegan, 34, and the Tigers are in agreement on a two-year, $19 million contract, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan on Tuesday, confirming a report. Detroit keeps a key bullpen piece as it seeks a third straight playoff appearance.

title: Slot wonders if Salah thinks he 'made a mistake'
content: Liverpool coach Arne Slot questioned whether Mohamed Salah should be the one to initiate a conversation with him following his explosive interview at the weekend.

title: Big 12 commish: Irish AD's behavior 'egregious'
content: Big 12 commissioner Brett Yormark took issue Tuesday with Notre Dame athletic director Pete Bevacqua's criticism this week of the ACC, calling his behavior "egregious."

title: Dybantsa, Wright fuel huge BYU rally vs. Clemson
content: Behind the largest second-half comeback in program history, one fueled by AJ Dybantsa and capped by Robert Wright III, BYU took down Clemson, 67-64, in the Jimmy V Classic on Tuesday night.

content: Chris Paul said he's "at peace with everything" and is excited for what's next following his stunning ouster from the LA Clippers earlier this month.

content: A number of teams have the need -- and means -- to trade for a starting pitcher this winter. Here's how they match up with available hurlers.

content: Australia's game against the United States won't be the biggest World Cup match that the Socceroos have ever played -- but it might be the most hyped.

content: In a week dominated by the fallout created by Mo Salah's comments, Arne Slot and Liverpool showed plenty of resolve in beating Inter 1-0 in the Champions League.

content: Everyone wants to know: which teams are in the group of death for the 2026 World Cup? Well, the "group of death" may be officially dead.

content: From first-round draft pick to iconic character, Ryan's path is a unique one. Plus, this week's key NHL games.

content: A growing number of athletic directors say they are interested in exploring a once-unthinkable option.

content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

title: Jameis Winston trolls Florida State football, praises women's soccer champs
content: The former Seminoles quarterback was excited about the Florida State's women's soccer team's fifth title ... and less than impressed by his old squad.

content: Bron Breakker's callout of CM Punk and Gunther's vow to make John Cena give up highlight Monday night's "Raw."

content: Liverpool are reportedly looking to improve their defense. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

content: Week 14 "set the tone" for many NFL teams as Super Bowl favorites faltered and underdogs picked up steam.

content: What lines offered value once odds came out? Here are five games we're eyeing for bets going into Week 15.

title: Pickups: Ryan Nembhard, Quentin Grimes among players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Foster cruises past Fulton, moves up at junior lightweight
content: O'Shaquie Foster was dominant against Stephen Fulton, earning higher ranking. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Lando Norris isn't an F1 'badass.' His vulnerability makes him a unique champion
content: In a sport where athletes are expected to be "badass," newly crowned F1 champion Lando Norris' openness to talking about his emotions is a rarity.

title: 'Went to Thailand for work': Goa nightclub owners seek transit anticipatory bail
content: Luthra brothers, owners of Birch by Romeo Lane, seek transit anticipatory bail in Delhi, claiming they traveled to Thailand for work and intend to cooperate with the investigation. Meanwhile, their beach shack in Goa is slated for demolition following a devastating fire that killed 25 people at their nightclub.

title: IndiGo crisis: DGCA deploys oversight team at airline's HQ; flight ops under lens
content: In response to recent flight disruptions that have left many passengers stranded, the Civil Aviation Ministry has established a specialized oversight team to oversee IndiGo's operations. This proactive step aims to mitigate the inconvenience caused by extensive delays and cancellations.

title: Sandeshkhali case: Witness against TMC leader hurt in accident; was enroute to court
content: A key witness in the Sandeshkhali attack case, Bholanath Ghosh, was critically injured in a road accident where his car was hit by a truck. His son and driver died in the incident. Ghosh's family alleges a conspiracy by TMC leader Shahjahan Sheikh, currently in jail, to silence him. The accident occurred while Ghosh was en route to court.

title: 'They can do a 10-part TV series': How teams prepare for IPL auctions? Team mentor reveals
content: Dinesh Karthik shared insights into the demanding IPL mini-auction build-up. He described the extensive planning and discussions involved. Karthik found the process challenging yet highly enjoyable. He highlighted the strategic depth and competitive nature of auction decisions. The Royal Challengers Bengaluru mentor emphasized the intricate work behind team selection.

title: PIO nurse sentenced to jail in UK for raping and assaulting colleagues in care home
content: An Indian-origin nurse, Naijil Paul, has been sentenced to over seven years in jail in Scotland for raping a colleague and sexually assaulting two others. Paul fled to India before his 2019 trial but was extradited after six years. He pleaded guilty to the charges, which occurred in 2018 while he managed Acorn Park Care Home in Glasgow.

title: 'Creator': Tesla CEO Elon Musk asked if he believes in God; here's what he said
content: Elon Musk shared his thoughts on faith, calling the Creator the funniest person he knows. He also spoke about the Department of Government Efficiency's partial success. Musk detailed SpaceX's Starship, highlighting its role in making humanity multi-planetary. This technology ensures planetary redundancy for survival.

title: 'My hero': Mahieka Sharma shares emotional posts; declares Hardik Pandya the 'king'
content: Hardik Pandya marked a powerful return from injury, leading India to a dominant win against South Africa and earning Player of the Match. He credited his comeback to self-belief and the unwavering support of loved ones, especially his girlfriend Mahieka Sharma. Pandya expressed his commitment to enjoying the game and striving for continuous improvement.

title: Gujarat teen chops friend into pieces over affairs
content: Jealousy over a shared love interest led to a brutal murder in Kutch. A 19-year-old allegedly killed his friend, dismembered the body, and buried the parts across the district. The crime surfaced after the victim's brother filed a missing person report, triggering an investigation that revealed a complex love triangle and a desperate attempt to conceal the horrific act.

title: HECI bill faces heat as CPI(M) MP warns of opaque drafting and threat to autonomy
content: A contentious battle is unfolding over the Centre’s move to introduce the Higher Education Commission of India Bill, with CPI(M) MP John Brittas urging ministers to halt the plan until the draft is made public and stakeholders are consulted. He warns that rushing the overhaul risks undermining autonomy, federal principles and the governance structure of India’s higher-education system.

title: H1b visas: US Embassy's advisory to applicants - 'Will not be allowed inside if'
content: US Embassy India has issued a crucial advisory for visa applicants, warning that attending a previously scheduled appointment after receiving a rescheduling notice will lead to denied entry. This comes as H-1B visa interviews are being postponed due to new social media vetting rules, potentially delaying foreign workers' return to the US for months.

title: Starlink in India: Price plans out; check details
content: Elon Musk's Starlink is set to launch satellite internet in India, with prices expected between Rs 2,500-3,500 monthly for consumers. The company has secured necessary licenses for various sectors, though official pricing awaits regulatory approvals and spectrum allocation.

title: ICC Rankings: Virat Kohli vs Rohit Sharma - Battle for No.1 ODI batter heats up
content: Star India batter Virat Kohli is closing in on the No.1 ODI batter ranking, now second behind Rohit Sharma after a stellar series against South Africa.  Other Indian cricketers like KL Rahul and Kuldeep Yadav also saw significant climbs in the ICC rankings across formats, highlighting India's strong presence in international cricket.

title: Google launches AI Plus in India; What users get for Rs 199 per month
content: Google has launched its AI Plus subscription in India. Priced at Rs 399 monthly, it offers advanced AI features. New users can get it for Rs 199 for six months. This plan provides access to Gemini 3 Pro, enhanced image and video creation tools, and more cloud storage. It aims to cater to India's growing AI engagement.

title: Two apples, one handwash: Pakistan's strangest theft case from judge's chamber
content: Police in Pakistan's Punjab province have registered a theft case over two apples and a hand wash bottle stolen from a sessions court judge's chamber in Lahore. The FIR was filed based on the judge's instructions, with the stolen items valued at Rs 1,000. The case is being investigated under Section 380 of the Pakistan Penal Code.

title: 'Don't want your mercy': Mamata Banerjee tears up MGNREGA note - watch
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee publicly tore up new MGNREGA norms, accusing the Centre of imposing 'valueless' conditions and withholding funds. She highlighted her state's Karmashree scheme as an alternative, vowing to increase workdays and asserting Bengal's fight for dignity and federal rights amidst upcoming elections.

title: Veggie 'burgers' under fire: Why is Europe planning to ban names of plant-based foods?
content: EU countries and lawmakers are set for contentious negotiations over a proposal to ban plant-based foods from using traditional meat labels like "sausage" and "burger." Backed by the European Parliament to protect farmers, the measure aims to reserve meat terminology for animal products, sparking debate over consumer transparency and the plant-based sector's future.

title: Nasa astronaut Jonny Kim returns from ISS after 8 months
content: NASA astronaut Jonny Kim has returned to Earth after an eight-month mission aboard the International Space Station. He conducted vital research in areas like bioprinting and robotics, contributing to advancements in medicine and future space exploration. The mission highlights the ISS's crucial role in scientific discovery and preparing for deeper space travel.

title: ‘Vande Mataram or Goa tragedy—what’s more emotional?’ Akhilesh blames BJP as Luthra brothers flee
content: A tragic fire in Goa claimed 25 lives. Samajwadi Party MP Akhilesh Yadav criticized government regulations. He stated the accused owners fled to Thailand. Authorities are investigating the expired licenses and the local body's failure to act. Efforts are underway to apprehend the fugitives.

title: Chinese woman uses her scarf to clean up spilled bubble tea in metro — watch
content: A thoughtful woman in China has earned widespread praise after using her own scarf to clean up spilled bubble tea on a subway. The heartwarming incident, captured on video, quickly went viral, highlighting her respect for public spaces.  In recognition of her considerate act, the subway company reportedly gifted her a new scarf and other presents.

title: 'How can tickets cost Rs 35-39k?' HC pulls up govt over IndiGo chaos
content: The Delhi high court questioned the Centre's failure to prevent IndiGo's flight cancellations and soaring airfares, demanding to know immediate measures taken for stranded passengers. The court also sought explanations on arrangements made to manage travellers and prevent harassment, as hundreds of flights were scrapped, leaving lakhs stranded nationwide.

title: More trouble for IndiGo? After 5,000 flight cancellations, CCI may launch probe
content: IndiGo faces potential competition law investigation following thousands of flight cancellations due to crew shortages. India's competition watchdog is considering probing the airline for misusing its dominant market position.

title: 'Will not accept': Tharoor declines 'Veer Savarkar Award'; here's what he said
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor declined the Veer Savarkar Award, calling organizers irresponsible for announcing his name without consent. He learned of the award through media reports and stated he neither knew about nor accepted it. HRDS India, however, claims they notified Tharoor and visited him to extend the invitation.

title: ‘Model neighbours’ to 'fugitives': Upscale Delhi colony in shock over 'missing' Luthra brothers
content: The family home of Goa nightclub owners Gaurav and Saurabh Luthra, implicated in a fatal fire, stands deserted in Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar. Neighbours recall the family as religious and good-natured, expressing shock at their alleged flight to Phuket. The brothers' business journey from local boutiques to successful cafes is also detailed.

title: IND vs SA: 'I don't sugarcoat things in my life' - Hardik's blunt take after match-winning return
content: Hardik Pandya attributes his strong comeback from injury to a positive mindset, enabling him to return "stronger, bigger and better." His impressive performance in the T20I against South Africa, featuring an unbeaten 59 and a wicket, showcased his full recovery. Pandya emphasized relying on inner confidence and enjoying the game, drawing energy from the crowd as a key motivator.

title: SpiceJet expands with 100 more flights daily! Stock jumps 5%
content: SpiceJet is significantly boosting its winter operations, adding up to 100 daily flights to meet surging demand amid IndiGo's widespread cancellations. This expansion, supported by reactivated aircraft, aims to capitalize on market gaps. IndiGo's pilot shortage led to over 5,000 flight cancellations and a government-mandated schedule reduction, creating an opportunity for competitors and potentially rebalancing market share.

title: Sudha Murty calls for teaching Vande Mataram in schools: How it benefits students
content: Rajya Sabha MP Sudha Murty urged making Vande Mataram compulsory in schools, highlighting its role in instilling courage, sacrifice, and a sense of belonging among students. Marking the song’s 150th anniversary, she emphasized its historical significance during India’s freedom struggle and noted that teaching national songs fosters values, civic consciousness, memory retention, and a lasting connection to the country’s cultural and moral heritage.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection day 6: Spy actioner crosses Rs 150 crore
content: Aditya Dhar's directorial 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has become a box office sensation, garnering positive reviews and impressive collections. The film demonstrated strong weekday stability, maintaining collections in the Rs. 20 crore range and is now eyeing Rs 200 crore by the end of its first week, with potential to enter the Rs 500 crore club.

title: Exclusive | 'It's loyalty': Rovman Powell on why Caribbean stars stick to their IPL franchises
content: Rovman Powell reflects on how franchise leagues transformed his life -- from financial security to building lifelong friendships. The West Indies power-hitter opens up about his journey from Bannister, discovering his talent early, and the discipline that shaped his career. Powell discusses natural Caribbean power, ILT20’s impact on UAE cricket, the Caribbean loyalty seen in IPL stars, and why six sixes in an over will soon be more common.

title: Diwali makes it to Unesco list; joins Yoga, Durga Puja among intangible cultural heritage
content: Deepavali has been inscribed on UNESCO's Intangible Cultural Heritage list, marking the 16th Indian tradition to receive this honor. This recognition occurred during the 20th session of the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage, hosted by India in New Delhi. The committee is reviewing 67 nominations from 79 countries.

title: 'Present comprehensive data': DGCA summons IndiGo CEO on Thursday; orders inspection at 11 airports
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has summoned IndiGo's CEO for an emergency meeting. This follows days of mass flight cancellations and passenger complaints. The regulator is conducting on-site assessments at airports. IndiGo leadership must account for its handling of the disruption. The airline has cancelled thousands of flights nationwide.

title: Gave fake name, ID: Watch how cops arrested Luigi Mangione for CEO murder
content: Newly released bodycam footage captures the moment murder suspect Luigi Mangione was apprehended at a Pennsylvania McDonald's, a year after his initial arrest. Alerted by customers recognizing his distinctive eyebrows, police confronted Mangione, who initially provided a false name.

title: Marvin Harrison Jr. injury update: Heel issue puts Cardinals WR’s week 15 return in doubt
content: Marvin Harrison Jr.'s rookie season faces another hurdle with a heel issue, sidelining him for Week 14 and making his Week 15 availability uncertain.  With the Cardinals out of playoff contention, they are unlikely to rush him back. Michael Wilson has stepped up significantly in Harrison's absence, capitalizing on increased opportunities and becoming a key offensive contributor.

title: 20 stitches! Cricket coach assaulted with bat over team selection; FIR lodged
content: Pondicherry U-19 coach S Venkataraman was severely assaulted by three local cricketers at the CAP training facility after being dropped from the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy squad. The attack, which left Venkataraman with a head injury and shoulder fracture, has led to an FIR and an ongoing police investigation against the assailants.

title: CBSE issues new rules for class 10 science, social science boards: What students must follow
content: CBSE has introduced new rules for Class 10 Science and Social Science exams. Students must now write answers only in their designated sections. Examiners will not award marks for answers placed in the wrong section, even if correct. Schools are urged to practice this format. This change aims to prevent confusion and mark loss during evaluations.

title: 107 oppn MPs submit notice to remove Madras HC judge over lamp-lighting order
content: Over 100 opposition MPs have submitted a notice to the Lok Sabha Speaker seeking the removal of Madras High Court Justice GR Swaminathan. They accuse him of misconduct and bias in a recent order concerning a lamp lighting at a temple near a dargah in Tamil Nadu.

title: Ex-AIIMS director Randeep Guleria on why vaccination must be priority for ageing adults
content: India's aging population faces increased infection risks due to declining immunity and chronic diseases. Experts urge integrating adult vaccinations like flu, pneumonia, and shingles into routine healthcare. Despite awareness of vaccination's importance, low uptake stems from poor risk perception and lack of structured programs. Proactive measures are crucial for healthy aging.

title: Amazon doubles down on India, announces a massive $35B investment by 2030
content: Amazon has pledged a massive $35 billion investment in India by 2030, building on its existing $40 billion. This significant capital infusion will focus on AI-driven digitization, boosting exports to $80 billion, and creating one million new jobs. The move follows Microsoft's substantial AI investment announcement, signaling a major tech push in the country.

title: Wedding cancelled: Smriti Mandhana's three big updates you can't miss - details inside
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana and composer Palash Muchhal have confirmed their wedding is called off. Mandhana returned to training and posted a cryptic message about control. Muchhal expressed anguish over baseless rumors and announced legal action. Both have requested privacy for their families. Mandhana reaffirms her focus on cricket for India's upcoming international season.

title: ‘Just a partner’: Goa nightclub co-owner’s 1st reaction after detention; hunt on for Luthras
content: Goa Police have detained Ajay Gupta, a co-owner of the Birch by Romeo Lane nightclub, following a deadly fire that claimed 25 lives.  Primary owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra fled to Phuket and are being sought via Interpol.  Authorities are also pursuing a British national connected to the property.  Several other club employees have been arrested as investigations intensify.

title: India captain: 'We always knew' - Ex-BCCI selector reveals Gill was earmarked since 2023
content: Shubman Gill's recent appointment as T20I vice-captain signals a clear path towards him becoming India's sole captain across all formats. Former selector Salil Ankola revealed Gill's leadership potential was recognised as early as 2023, with consensus among selectors and senior players. Gill's exceptional batting and Test captaincy in England solidified confidence in his readiness to lead.

content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. title: 'It's an advantage': How post-ups became the NBA's most efficient play
content: post-ups were once a staple of inside-out offenses across the league . but by 2019, they'd been declining in frequency for years . in a post-game rant, a coach on the Dallas Mavericks explained why .

title: Canada unveils new 'Express Entry' category for doctors
content: a new Express Entry category will be created for foreign doctors with at least one year of recent Canadian work experience . invitations under the new stream will begin in early 2026 . the govt will also reserve 5,000 federal admission spaces for provinces and territories to nominate licensed physicians with job offers .

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: Previewing the NBA Cup quarterfinals
content: the 2025 Emirates NBA Cup quarterfinals kick off on tuesday . leBron James goes off for 29 points to power the lakers to a close win over the 76ers . the team will have to advance without star Franz Wagner, who left the game because of a high ankle sprain .

title: 'Don’t want a woman who marries her brother...': Trump slams Ilhan Omar
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. content: AJ Dybantsa announced his commitment to BYU in 2024 . the Cougars were the first five-star recruits since the ESPN recruiting database started in 2007 . a balanced mix of stars and role players has been a key factor for the team .
